thread.title: Athlete of the Week Nixa's Joey Clem
thread.title_full: Athlete of the Week Nixa's Joey Clem

title: Athlete of the Week Nixa's Joey Clem
text:
Posted : Wednesday, 14 October 2015 7:40PM Athlete of the Week: Nixa's Joey Clem Jonathan Huskey Reporting 
NIXA, Mo. -- Second verse, same as the first for Nixa soccer. 
Or, something like that. 
After Joey Clem announced his presence with authority during a junior campaign that saw the Eagles reach the 20 win plateau, he’s leading his team to those same heights and hopefully beyond as a senior. 
“When you give him the ball, good things are going to happen,” said head coach Evan Palmer. 
The 2014 season ended in districts with a loss to Kickapoo, and that has fueled the Eagles so far this season. 
“These guys have that goal in mind,” Palmer said. “They’re going to fight, scrape and claw to get there.” 
Nixa returns virtually the entire 2014 team. 
“We had basically the same team last year,” Clem said. “We knew coming in to this year we could almost replicate what we did last year.” 
Clem is the unquestioned leader of this team, the guy the players look to to steady the ship when the waters get choppy. 
“He’s a calming influence,” Palmer said. “He knows when to be intense and when to kind of back off a little bit. When he has to, [he can] take it himself, he can pass it off, he can get goals off of crosses, whether finishing with his feet or with his head. He just does it in a variety of ways.” 
His coach says there’s something else that sets Clem apart: 
“He just loves to play.” 
In fact, during the offseason, if he can’t find a game in Nixa, Clem will head to Springfield and the intramural fields at Missouri State, ones with an affectionate nickname. 
“Taco Bell fields, that’s what it is in Springfield,” Clem said of the fields that back right up to the fast food restaurant on the Bear campus. “Anywhere I could play during the summer, I would.” 
He faces a variety of players. 
“They’re a lot older than me,” he said. “It can range anywhere from college kids, usually, to grown men.” 
Clem said playing against the older, bigger players helps him translate his game back on the high school level. It seems to have worked, and Joey Clem is the Ozone Athlete of the Week. Filed Under :
